subtitleNullable: Images with or without tennis balls
descriptionNullable:
### Context

Used for an undergraduate robotics project at the University of Birmingham, UK. Images taken with a robot camera.

### Content

A `train` and `test` folder, each of which contains a `balls` and `empty` folder. The `balls` folders hold images of the lower floor of the CS building, with a tennis ball at some point in the image. The `empty` folders hold images of the lower floor of the CS building with no tennis ball.

The `test` folder contains a random sample of the total image set. Some images will be very similar to `train` images and some will be somewhat different, due to the nature of the photography.

Some images are blurred and the position of the tennis ball in the `ball` images varies.
title: Binary Tennis Ball Classification
subtitle: Images with or without tennis balls
description:
### Context

Used for an undergraduate robotics project at the University of Birmingham, UK. Images taken with a robot camera.

### Content

A `train` and `test` folder, each of which contains a `balls` and `empty` folder. The `balls` folders hold images of the lower floor of the CS building, with a tennis ball at some point in the image. The `empty` folders hold images of the lower floor of the CS building with no tennis ball.

The `test` folder contains a random sample of the total image set. Some images will be very similar to `train` images and some will be somewhat different, due to the nature of the photography.

Some images are blurred and the position of the tennis ball in the `ball` images varies.
